pages.text: A $(9)Gem$() is a crystal of condensed strength.$(p)When socketed into an affix item, a Gem will provide a powerful bonus.$(p)Gems may give different bonuses in different items, and can be upgraded.

pages.title: Purity
pages.text: Each gem has a Purity, ranging from $(#808080)Cracked$() to $(6)Perfect$().$(p)The purity alone determines the strength of the gem, and higher purity gems are more expensive to upgrade.$(p)A $(6)Perfect$() Gem may no longer be upgraded.

pages.title: Obtaining Gems
pages.text: Gems can be found in chest loot, and may rarely be found when killing mobs. Gem drops are more common for real players, but have a very small chance to drop from machines or other automation sources.$(p)Gems are more likely to drop from Bosses.

pages.title: Socketing Gems
pages.text: To socket a gem into an item, combine the two in a Smithing Table.$(p)Each gem states which items it may fit in.$(p)Some gems are $(#C73912)Unique$(), meaning that only one copy of that gem may be socketed in an item.

pages.title: Removing Gems
pages.text: Removing gems from an item was a difficult process, but some clever alchemists figured out how to do it.$(p)Their notes are detailed on the next page.

pages.title: Sigil of Withdrawal
pages.text: Combine a socketed item with a $(9)Sigil of Withdrawal$() in a smithing table to remove the socketed gems from an item. The item and all gems will be returned.
